title: Air Traffic Landings Statistics
description: A. SUMMARY This dataset consists of San Francisco International Airport (SFO) The aircraft landing dataset contains data about aircraft landings at SFO with monthly landing counts and landed weight by airline, region and aircraft model and type. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Data is self-reported by airlines and is only available at a monthly level. C. UPDATE PROCESS Data is available starting in July 1999 and will be updated monthly. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Airport data is seasonal in nature; therefore, any comparative analyses should be done on a period-over-period basis (i.e. January 2010 vs. January 2009) as opposed to period-to-period (i.e. January 2010 vs. February 2010). It is also important to note that fact and attribute field relationships are not always 1-to-1. For example, Cargo Statistics belonging to United Airlines will appear in multiple attribute fields and are additive, which provides flexibility for the user to derive categorical Cargo Statistics as desired. E. RELATED DATASETS A summary of monthly comparative air-traffic statistics is also available on SFO’s internet site at https://www.flysfo.com/about/media/facts-statistics/air-traffic-statistics

columns.name: Activity Period
columns.description: The year and month at which passenger, cargo or landings activity took place.

columns.name: Activity Period Start Date
columns.description: Start date of The year and month at which passenger, cargo or landings activity took place.

columns.name: Operating Airline
columns.description: Airline name for the operator of aircraft with landing activity

columns.name: Operating Airline IATA Code
columns.description: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) two-letter designation for the Operating Airline.

columns.name: Published Airline
columns.description: Airline name that issues the ticket and books revenue for landings activity.

columns.name: Published Airline IATA Code
columns.description: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) two-letter designation for the Published Airline.

columns.name: GEO Summary
columns.description: Designates whether the passenger, cargo or landings activity in relation to SFO arrived from or departed to a location within the United States (“domestic”), or outside the United States (“international”) without stops

columns.name: GEO Region
columns.description: Provides a more detailed breakdown of the GEO Summary field to designate the region in the world where activity in relation to SFO arrived from or departed to without stops.

columns.name: Landing Aircraft Type
columns.description: A designation for three types of aircraft that landed at SFO, which includes passenger aircraft, cargoonly aircraft (“freighters”) or combination aircraft (“combi”).

columns.name: Aircraft Body Type
columns.description: A designation that is independent from Landing Aircraft Type, which determines whether commercial aircraft landed at SFO is a wide body jet, narrow body jet, regional jet or a propeller operated aircraft.

columns.name: Aircraft Manufacturer
columns.description: Manufacturer name for the aircraft that landed at SFO.

columns.name: Aircraft Model
columns.description: Model designation of aircraft by the manufacturer.

columns.name: Aircraft Version
columns.description: Variations of the Aircraft Model, also known as the “dash number”, designated by the manufacturer to segregate unique versions of the same model.

columns.name: Landing Count
columns.description: The number of aircraft landings associated with General and Landings Statistics attribute fields.

columns.name: Total Landed Weight
columns.description: The aircraft landed weight (in pounds) associated with General and Landings Statistics attribute fields.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: The datetime of the data as of.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: The datetime of the data loaded at.
